Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: hobbes63069
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for a one night stay before flying out early Monday morning. It was near the airport and the car rental return and had good reviews, but I think the other people must have stayed at another hotel. The place was old, worn out and dismal. Our window looked out into an alley and the bathroom was filled with cracked tiles, moldy corners, and looked dirty. The carpet was old and worn. The heater produced damp, clammy air. The deck clerk was rude when we checked in - I stood beside the only person checking in and the clerk snapped at me to "get in line" like there were dozens of people waiting. I would strongly suggest that you spend a few dollars more and go somewhere that was more welcoming. It was not a deal for what we paid, even in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: SunLover990
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights early March. Breakfast was very good with good variety. Front desk service was excellent and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: nd02155
Reviews.Content: The Ramada San Diego Airport is great hotel if you're looking to not spend too much. The halls are not smelly like some have mentioned, it's just an older hotel that needs a little updating so the smell is just because of the age of the building. The rooms are nicely decorated and very cozy, we had a balcony with a view of the marina across the street which was nice. Friendly helpful staff and many restaturants close by.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Round Lake Beach, Illinois, United States
Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: KMC12_2007 Posted by a Wyndham Hotel Group traveler
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. The complimentary breakfast was very good, especially the waffles! This Ramada may be older and need some updating, however, attempts have been to update. Our bathroom was updated and everything worked great! Loved having a mini fridge and microwave in the room. Part of the charm of this motel is it's age. I was very impressed with how quiet the motel was being so close to the airport. Very affordable for the area. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ahop1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in need of updating, but was clean and the staff friendly and helpful. We stayed here the night before heading out from the airport and on the way back in. Compared to other hotels it was reasonably priced. We used their shuttle to and from the airport and had no problems - they were efficient and on-time.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest remodel we've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: skeeter762
Reviews.Content: Usually when you hear that a hotel has been recently renovated, you tend to be doubting. However, this Ramada has done a fine job! High quality, clean, nice breakfast. Friendly staff. Excellent location on Point Loma, right across from the Marina. Good sized rooms and bathroom. Plenty of windows for light and to let in the ocean breezes. Brand new fridge & microwave, and flat screen TV too. Very nice. We're glad we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport!”
Reviews.Author: HaveRiceWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights. Great location on Point Loma, I got to all the sights I wanted to see very quickly. Room was nice but on the small side. However, I didn't need a whole lot of legroom for such a short trip. Staff was very considerate. They let me keep my luggage there after checkout while I went on one final tour before I returned my rental car. Hope to use this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE PROPERTY-BREAKFAST-OWNERS & STAFF”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTrvln
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this property for over 5 yrs..and I have to say, the owners and staff are what make it stand out! They ALWAYS greet you when you walk in the door, ALWAYS make sure all your questions are answered, and ALWAYS make sure you leave with a smile. Most recently I was at the property and got to have breakfast...YUMM, HOT HOME MADE WAFFLES!! MY FAVORITE!!! Normally when hotels say breakfast it's nothing but pastries and juice..NOT HERE..you can make your own waffle..OR WAFFLES, there is no one to tell you that you can't have moe than one! They ceral, oatmeal, pastries, coffee, an assorment of juices, bread, bagels...etc...You will be full by the time you leave. The property is VERY clean, always smells fresh and ALWAYS has someone at the front desk. Sometimes you may go to a property and have to ring a bell, but not here..there's always a smile behind the desk. the owners care about their property and it shows...if you get a chance..stay here..have a waffle!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: Marcy M
Reviews.Content: We don't recommend this hotel. The hallways are old and smelly, rooms redecorated but finish work in bathrooms old and shabby. The final straw was a 2 inch cockroach in the bathroom. I told the management about it, and got bupkis. Interesting that the front desk called us 15 minutes after checking in "to see if everything was ok", but customer service isn't really what they have. Unsecured outer doors at the end of the hallways was a concern also.

Reviews.Title: “Missed "great" by that much.”
Reviews.Author: Global-track
Reviews.Content: Let me get ny one concern out of the way first. There are outside stairways, each one with doors to each floor, and they don't get locked. Ever. These days, that's not only a concern, it's a liability. The hotel does have some haway cams spread around, theough. Amazingly, the breakfast room has a room card reader at the door to keep undesirables from eating the muffins. Go figure. As to the good side, the staff is absolutely fantastic. They're not pretending to be couteous and thoughtful, as with so many other properties. The room is comfortable. I had a fantastic view of the harbor from both the room and balcony.Although it's fairly close to the airport, my room on the top floor was quiet and I had the best hotel sleep I can remember. The famous Gas Light District of San Diego (a must visit) is a mere 4 miles down Harbor. The hotel has some age on it and, yes, the elevator is so slow it must run on compressed molassis, but my stay was sill a pleasant surprise. I go to San Diego now and then, and I'll be back to this Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: cnd_vacation_luvr
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in two rooms, and the hotel staff put us together in adjoining rooms that were separated from the other rooms on the floor by a hallway on the 3rd floor of the corner wing. It was nice to open the connecting door and share all the space. Getting the shuttle from the airport was easy, and they offered shuttle service to the cruise port as well. The rooms were clean, had great comfortable beds, and the usual refrigerator and microwave. We also had small outdoor balconies. You can see from the photo that it is an older property, but it has been nicely renovated. We checked across the hall and saw that some king size rooms had a nice view of the marina that was across from us. Other reviews have commented on the elevator, and I agree it is small, but we managed just fine and often used the stairs. I noticed that there were accessible rooms handily located on the ground floor. The breakfast was cereal, make-you-own waffles, pastries, yogurt, toast, that sort of thing. Denny's is a short walk away if you want bacon and eggs. The breakfast room was well maintained. Here I saw families, older couples, and a few businesspeople. There was an outdoor pool area with lounge chairs but it was a little bit too cool outside to try, but it looked appealing and would be popular in warmer weather, I imagine. The neighborhood, which I think is called Point Loma, has small restaurants, stores, and the marina all just outside. There is a huge shopping complex a short cab ride away. I thought we might be isolated from all the sights, but since we've been to San Diego before it didn't bother us. Having a rental car would make getting around easy and there is free parking at the hotel, but we didn't feel the need to get one. All in all we had a very pleasant 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for airport layover”
Reviews.Author: RobertULondon
Reviews.Content: cheap, cheerful, clean, ok breakfast, good location, friendly airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MillikenVisitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my recent personal trip to San Diego. Great price and location; clean, quiet, close to the airport, and easy access to sightseeing. It's a very clean, nice, older hotel with a friendly staff. I enjoyed my short three-day stay and would recommend this hotel. Also, if time is available on your trip, I'd recommend the self-guided tour of the Midway aircraft carrier.

Reviews.Title: “best in pt loma for the price, excellent staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: laurie j
Reviews.Content: i drove into shelter island from LAX after returning from australia and fiji. had 2 weeks to spend in san diego but was on a tight budget. saw a few places advertising weekly rates that were a nightmare...this is the best location for the price, period. views of the fishing pier, marina and city skyline. older but clean and the staff is exemplary. being a smoker, it was nice to not feel like a felon with a pool view king, remodeled room. i went to disneyland for a few days and wanted to return but they were fully booked. the gm notified me by phone when there was a cancellation and i got my same room for another 3 days. wonderful for what it is! p.s. the bar is now closed so it is VERY quiet. loved standing on the balcony in the evenings just gazing at the pool and boats...

Reviews.Title: “Good place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Georgelovetotravel
Reviews.Content: What I like of this Hotel is the service! The rooms that have been just remodeled and I like the decoration, the location and the breakfast ( Includes Do it your self waffles, cereal, pastries, juices, coffe and tea! The rooms facing Rosecrans street are noisier than the other rooms! You can walk to some restaurants, coffee shops and the marina! Also the price is lower in weekdays but I think is a fair price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but ....”
Reviews.Author: blues911
Reviews.Content: This was a one night trip to SD. This hotel is in a very busy area. The parking lot is small and at the time of my arrival they were doing concrete staining on several of the driveways. Check in was very quick and very easy. The hotel elevator is a joke, it says it can hold 8 people, 8 very small and I mean very small people. The hallways were a bit dark for me and the smell of bug killer was a big turn off. Once I opened my room I was shocked at the size of it, but it did have everything you need, a nice big bed, a mini fridge, a microwave, desk top radio. I had a very large balcony with 2 seats and a small table. The bathroom worked but the size of the toilet and bath area was very very small. I was in SD for a fitness event and if I had been my old size it would have been a tough fit. The water pressure was good. The only drawback was the loud closing of doors in the hallway at night, come to find out that those loud doors closing were the exit doors. They were loud. The morning breakfast was good, not great, but it had everything you would expect. Would I go back..hmmm with SD their are so many other hotels I am not sure. it was good, not great. Three out of 5 stars for me.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego, California”
Reviews.Author: ShariR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great especially I think it's only rated a 2 1/2 star. The room was a smoking room which is perfect. It was clean a big and just like the picture on the web site. My only compliant would be that the room could use a new carpet as the carpet was stained other than that it was perfect!! Great location close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: DiBecker
Reviews.Content: We drove from Vegas to here, we didnt have to drive through the city to get here which was nice. It was easy to find and had lots of free parking. If we didnt have the car I wouldve prefered to stay closer to the centre of San Diego but its a quick drive - if you can find somewhere to park. Breakfast was good, saw my first waffle machine. Staff friendly and free internet useful for checking flights etc. The pool is Ok, we had some time out there.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tinyvella
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego when there was a total black out so no lighting whatsoever! we only stayed one night too before our travels but the night we stayed, we found our room large , more than clean enough (in the morning light!) and the staff really really helpful. Good free brekkie too! Free airport transfer too which was great. I'd defo stay again and a bargain price too.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay for our family with two small children”
Reviews.Author: yaj0149
Reviews.Content: Check in and check out was fast and easy. Our room was clean and spacious; no bugs or odors. All of our preferences were honored (1st floor room, housekeeping visit before 1 pm) and our hostess was considerate enough to assign us to a room close to the entrance where we could easily walk from our room to our vehicle and the breakfast room with our two small children and luggage. We will definitely be staying here during our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “So-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: mathildaproost
Reviews.Content: Of course the photos don't tell the entire story. Parts of the the hotel and rooms have been updated (the ones included for the promo photos), but this is an old property. The room needed paint; there are many scratch marks. Furnishings are a mix of old and new, and are somewhat mix-matched. If you're going to revamp, please go all the way. The location is quite convenient and easy to get to. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for saving our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Leaucoj
Reviews.Content: Awesome service! Easy to find, close to airport and Point Loma, free parking, simple but good free breakfast, clean and well kept rooms, and so incredibly friendly and helpful it's amazing. We stayed here to go to a wedding; arrived after having a bad experience picking up a rental and putting the bride's day on hold only to find everyone here to be extremely polite, respectful, friendly, and genuinely nice. We came in one night, checked out to leave town for a bit, then came back two days later. They had our names immediately, remembered and asked about the wedding, asked if we needed any directions and then printed them out for us, gave us a map of the city, let us check in early to get ready, and were overall terrific. It was a great atmosphere and very stress-free. thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Easy way to park your car for the airport”
Reviews.Author: 1BookLady
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been upgraded and were very nice; the bar was closed for remodeling, but what I liked the most was the free shuttle to and from the airport and the opportunity to leave our car for a very low price per day.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Shixson22
Reviews.Content: We booked a smoking room, and when we got there they told us they didn't have any available. Without us even saying anything they upgraded us to a room with a harbor view and a balcony so that we were satisfied. The customer service was beyond great and the cleaniliness was amazing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AFFORDABLE,CLEAN, GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: stc33Usa
Reviews.Content: We were on a coastal trip of CA and had been traveling from LA and got in very late. WE had reservations for 2 nights in SD but got there 2 nights earlier than expected. Our other hotel was booked solid. SO I needed something very quick and needed something cheap but clean and also with FREE PARKING, We called a few places and finally settled here. On the phone we were quoted $89/night, but got there and she gave it to us for $79!! We didn't even ask, she just did it. She and the other staff person we encountered were both very friendly and helpful!!! They even called once we got in the room and asked if everything was ok. THis is an older hotel, but was fully updated and they were even doing other updates that we could see. It's about 6 miles from SD zoo and we had car so I can't account for transportation from there. It was VERY close to airport so I would recommend for that for sure. Rooms were clean and had everything we needed. CLose to restaurants and the harbour/bay. I would def stay again for that price and location!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty musty nowhere near my expectation of a Ramada Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gspmama
Reviews.Content: Arrived @ the San Diego Airport 6/4/2011. Called the hotel from the airport we were told that a white van with red Ramada Inn on it would be sent to pick us up. About 15 minutes later we boarded a Ramada Inn van, however this was the van for the gaslamp hotel. Upon our arrival at the gaslamp hotel we were informed we were at the wrong hotel and that we would need to take a cab back to the correct hotel. Cost us $20 to get back to the right hotel. When we pulled up to the hotel we immediatelely noticed it looked much older than the pictures on the computer. Th lobby was musty, we had to go up stairs than outside by the pool than inside to the final room (non smoking with a bay view)! The room was nasty, musty, pubic hair on the toilet and in the tub. We called up the front desk to clean the bathroom, we were told they could bring us towels but housekeeping had gone home for the day. Told them that that was unacceptable, please clean the room!!!! We immediately left to go out to dinner and the Astros Padres game. When we came back to our room the toilet was cleaned but the tub still had hair in it. We chose to leave and were lucky enough to get a room at the Courtyard Marriott where we had great service, a clean room and bathroom, and a beautiful facility with a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the price of admission”
Reviews.Author: callmevelma
Reviews.Content: We were out for a wedding, and my entire family ended up staying here. The rooms were small, but clean and well taken care of. There was construction going on on the property, and they started work REALLY early, hammering outside our window. Other than that, it was quiet. The location couldn't have been better since the wedding was on Shelter Island...just minutes away. The breakfast could have been better, but that's about the only thing I'd change. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Seneca044
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks a little dated from the outside, and the neighborhood is far from new, but the rooms have been remodeled and the bathrooms are quite nice. We picked this place primarily for its location--it was close to a wedding we attended --and we were pleasantly surprised what our $84 per night got us. A/C worked well, though you rarely need it in San Diego and the hotel is across the street from the fishing pier. Decent, inexpensive restaurants in area and breakfast at hotel is standard fare of waffles, danish, cereal, apples, and bananas. Certainly not luxurious, but San Diego (and SoCal in general) can be expensive and the Ramada was very reasonable. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great view of harbor, good value, wonderful people for staff!”
Reviews.Author: citygirl028
Reviews.Content: Airport shuttle and great bus transportation around City. People at hotel were all so kind and courteous when we inquired about sight-seeing, church information and restaurants. The view of the harbor across the street was so peaceful for walking. There was some noise from remodeling going on, but we were gone during the daytime. Wonderful breakfast with waffle maker and fresh fruit and yogurt etc. was available. Rooms were nice and clean, refrigerator and microwave in each room. Great value. Good place for seniors and young families. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Near to Airport in quite place”
Reviews.Author: jkp80
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice although you may feel the look is a little old. The doors of elevator (lift) were opening/closing very slowly. The person at the lobby was very kind and helpful to provide us with the information. Best part is that this hotel serves continental breakfast included in room price. Free parking is available which might be an issue with other hotels. Not that fancy a hotel but comfortable. Rooms were clean. Had microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service around”
Reviews.Author: imfs
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about my stay. Went to sea world with the family and glad we ended up staying here. Free breakfast, which includes waffles, fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, toast, oatmeal, and cereal. The rooms are very nice. We ended up staying on the third floor balcony looking at the harbor. Nice place to drink a cup of coffee in the morning. Checkout was fast and the nice gentleman was very helpful with our needs. Will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of potential, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 3boysMomandDad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location. Most of the staff should find another line o work, because customer service is not their best skill. The hallways were clean, but smelled bad. The room was nice and comfortable. Easy access to the freeway and Harbor Drive. Great breakfast with a choice of fresh made waffles, pastries, bagels, cereals, fresh fruit coffee and juice.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are exceptionally helpful and kind.”
Reviews.Author: pandababy1954
Reviews.Content: The best feature of the Ramada Limited San Diego Airport is the staff. Every person was pleasant, cheerful and helpful. The hotel was clean and affordable. The location had good bus service and dining. All together, a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: ldwelch
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this Ramada. It is not a fancy hotel, but the service is great, it is located within walking distance from restaurants and Shelter Island. The rooms are clean and the bed comfortable. Breakfast is not fancy, but there is a nice selection and they did not run out of fruit. The staff is helpful and friendly. We stayed in a room with a balcony, which is nice for morning coffee, or evening drinks and snacks. The elevator is old and small, but we used the stairs for more exercise. All of the hotels in this part of town are old and have been or are being renovated. I liked this one the best.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE & QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: BILLYLEW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this motel 3 nights in March and 1 night in April. We found the staff to be the most friendly we have encountered in many years. They were very responsive to our needs. My wife and I are both world travelers, having visited more than 50 countries and are very aware of how we are treated at motels and hotels worldwide. This is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value”
Reviews.Author: fazik
Reviews.Content: 'Very much appreciated this stay - a solid value - and I've stayed in a full scope of rooms from the Four Seasons to Motel 6. An airport shuttle (don't forget to phone ahead to let them know you've arrived), inclusive WIFI, local calls and parking, proximity to public transit (bus 28/connection to SD Trolly system, 923/992 and local attractions (Ocean Beach and Downtown SD/Harbour/Embarcadero) are all excellent amenities. Coupled with an off-airport car rental at Enterprise (R), you won't find a better alternative in SD at the price. I was able to secure a very competitive rate for the stay directly through Ramada site (although sourced initially through Priceline.com). Staff (especially co-manager, Juyita) was courteous, helpful and accommodating. Rooms are large enough, but oversized furniture and interior design don't maximize spatial quality. Room 202 had nice alcove adjacent bathroom, but not much of a view. Wet area (including dressing alcove) nicely outfitted (granite flat surfaces, including vanity). Fridge and microwave in room with adequate access to restaurants and grocery. The hallways are the most notable detraction - need updating, and hall lights at night shine through under door. Neither of these should otherwise deter guests. Rooms are clean and housekeeping staff is attentive to cleanliness. Breakfast is adequate - nothing spectacular - and self-serve hot waffles available. I did take the opportunity to pass on (via private forum) a few business "tweaks" to management, primarily guest room space utilisation and healthy menu offerings for breakfast. Overall, a good experience for solid value. Of course, everyone has their own preferences, thresholds and opinions. This is just one data point. In any event, 'njoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap fares, good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: NoukyMontreal
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night at the Ramada Limited Hotel. After a long flight from Montréal to San Diego, we were too tired to drive to our final destination (Oceanside) so we booked a night at this hotel to get some rest with our 3-year-old daughter. The hotel is quiet old but the rooms are clean. I hate the fact that we had to get out of the hotel to join the front desk by the other door. The staff was very nice, nothing bad to say about them, they clearly enjoy to serve their customers. The very bad thing was the noise (our room was close to the street) and worst, the walls are so thin that we heard our room neighbors having lourd orgasms during a few hours, so we couldn't sleep at all. And in the early morning, the couple left their room but forgot to switch the alarm clock to off...I know this is not the hotel's fault but this can be very disturbing for some people. On the other hand, breakfast was good with lot of choices. If you have a small budget and need to be close to the city and the airport and you're not planning to stay for more than one or two nights, this hotel could be a good choice. Otherwise, it would be worth to pay a $25 more for a more comfortable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel for the value.”
Reviews.Author: Susy_11
Reviews.Content: Room was very attractive and kept very clean. Comfortable bed and room had refrigerator, microwave, coffeepot and iron/ironing board which all came in handy. The room rate was a good value and the staff was very pleasant and helpful in directing us to sights to see and places to eat. Very close to things and easy to get to. Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good sleep, good staff.”
Reviews.Author: Colleen F
Reviews.Content: My phone reservation was efficiently and helpfully taken by Cecilia, and the free airport shuttle reliably picked us up for the short ride. The check in was smooth, the room was clean and quiet, and internet and a continental breakfast were also both included. All was as advertised - we will stay again. C. Fraser, Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at a reasonable rate!”
Reviews.Author: chrispaint
Reviews.Content: From the seamless shuttle service to and from the airport, to the friendly, helpful staff, this motel is a winner. The room was clean, had all the usual amenities plus a microwave, coffee maker and a refrigerator. Free breakfast with waffles, bagels,fruit,rolls,cereal,yogurt, coffee, tea and juice. Location was on the bus line and close to many attractions. I will stay here every time I come to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is alive and well here!”
Reviews.Author: LTLA
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego for military training period. Moved from hotel that cost twice as much with half the service to the Ramada that was recommended by a local. Staff is unbelievably accomodating to changes in military orders that affected length of stay. Staff is there as much as you need them to be and the place is quiet. Great workout area that has the basics to blow off steam after a long day. Would definitely recommend staying here while in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant service”
Reviews.Author: LCNtraveller
Reviews.Content: King bed room has sizable fridge, microwave, desk, in-room safe. Older TV and remote. Muggy weather made the air-con unit a necessity all night, so I was glad to have earplugs with me. Energy-saving light switches. Breakfast buffet includes self-made waffles. The outdoor pool is nice. Pleasant reception staff offered good service. They were welcoming to our group. The historic trolley tours of San Diego can pick up and drop off guests at the hotel at certain times.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Experience "I wouldn't if I were you"”
Reviews.Author: zac11485
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff albeit nice, could not compensate for the poor conditions and atmosphere. If you are going to be traveling in the San Diego area, I would only use this hotel option as a last resort. The clientele resemble that of a red light district crack/prostitute motel... The room was pieced together (not in a good way) and the bathrooms were gross. After my shower I was afraid to walk barefoot on the floors...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the price”
Reviews.Author: Dman404
Reviews.Content: Staff very nice, free wifi and use of computer in lobby when my laptop went down. Close to everything, 10-15 mins to most locations I visited, Zoo,Sea world, USS Midway,Balboa Park. Free Parking. Quiet and nice area along Point Loma to walk along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to San Diego Airport”
Reviews.Author: WisteriaWay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, a retired couple recently had the pleasure of staying one night at the Ramada Limited San Diego Airport. We were very pleased with the location, cleanliness and proximity to the airport. The room was small, adequately furnished and very clean. The mattress was very comfortable. Desk service was very friendly and helpful. Free WiFi is available. The motel is literally across the street from a bunch of nice, non-fast food restaurants located on the marina and a nice place for a leisurely stroll. It is a very short distance form the airport; less than 10 minutes and an easy drive.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Location in Point Loma”
Reviews.Author: LegalGenie
Reviews.Content: We stay "at home" with these people up to 4 times per year and have for more than 4 years; the service is extraordinary. If you want Value, Cleanliness and to be in the best location in or near Point Loma (our favorite spot), then this is the place to stay. Many FREE extras are: continental breakfast, internet service, parking and airport shuttle. If you are looking for new, expensive or anything of the sort go somewhere else...these are just Real Good People providing terrific service to travelers while making you feel like Family.

Reviews.Title: “If you are claustrophobic, this is not the place for you...”
Reviews.Author: KayMack
Reviews.Content: Check your confirmation before you go. Our confirmation did not specify our bed sizes although we descussed it with Brayan on the phone. They tried telling us they we sold out & tried sticking us in a room with 2 double beds (mind you my husband is 6'4" & 280 lbs - no way he could fit comfortably with me or a kid on the bed). The front desk managed to find a smelly, smokey room with 2 queen size beds. The toilet/shower room is not accommodating for any average sized adult (you can not close the door without stepping on the toilet or in the tub). The continental breakfast was OK but the orange juice/apple juice combination stuff was nasty! The staff was nice. I would not recommend this hotel especially if you have children. It is more like an hourly motel sporting the Ramada name!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms, very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: loveitoutdoors
Reviews.Content: Friendliness makes a big difference,and the staff at this hotel are delightful. The rooms are in excellent remodeled shape. beds are comfortable. It is clean, has a big bathroom, a large flat screen TV, and FREE WiFi (in rooms & lobby), ample breakfast and parking! Lobby also has a guest computer. Also has a free shuttle to the airport which you need to book in advance. Location is in Point Loma, near good restaurants & the marina. Downside? Walls are thin, but it was only a bother when a group of people came in late from partying and were noisy in the hallway. Styrofoam cups for coffee... ugh.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AT A GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: globaltrekster
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location minutes away from the harbor and Balboa Park Staff is excellent - friendly when I asked for directions Breakfast is sufficient, nothing grand, but it is free and is enough to get you going Rooms are clean, linen and towels are clean, not noisy Does have a fridge and coffee maker, no microwave Cons: internet did not work most of the time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Service and Cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: billdoumar
Reviews.Content: After being a client in another Motel in Point Loma for nearly 25 years I decided to give my business to Ramada. For the past three years I have stayed in Ramada and in each trip I noticed the changes and progress.

Reviews.Title: “Don't choose this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: etrek99
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation for June 27th but had a change of plans. When I called up a week before to cancel, they said I can't do it because it was non refundable. This is the most ridiculous thing I've encountered because most hotels would allow you to change or cancel the reservation. In my opinion, this is the most sneaky and unethical thing to do, and they should at least put it in red bold letters on their web site, as most people would not have expected it. I believe I was like most travelers who normally focus on the price, cleanliness, safety, etc. and would not have paid much attention to the cancellation policy. There are lots of other hotels available in the San Diego Airport area, and I'll never recommend this hotel because of their sneaky, underhanded way of snaring people.

Reviews.Title: “Great value,super location and nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: a p
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights based on trip advisor comments. I was a little worried when I pulled up as the exterior appeared shabby. But was pleasantly surprised when entering rooms that are modest size but very nicely updated..super comfortable bed and bathrooms were fresh. The interior of this hotel is reminiscent of a 2 or 3 star European B&B. The fitness room had new equipment and the breakfast was decent. Wireless was speedy and reliable. Staff were friendly,helpful and accommodating. Note many rooms may be noisy but higher floor and facing back may be best bet. Super deal and location is excellent with access to most major freeways. Major shopping and restaurants easy drive.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lissaz
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this Ramada, We had 3 rooms all were VERY CLEAN! and Beautiful, The staff was great they were always happy and very helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast everything was fresh and well stocked. We recommend this hotel to EVERYONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience, Warmth & Value.”
Reviews.Author: richardpuetz
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The room was very nice and the breakfast was a great bonus. The bed was larger than my front lawn at home. Staff was very professional, helpful, and welcoming. We found lots of great places nearby for sunset cocktails and dinner. The shuttles were time-saving and convenient. Great budget value, I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here every time hotel near attractions and restrauants.”
Reviews.Author: naturekeeper
Reviews.Content: We stay here at this hotel, we received excellent service, when we wanted to go somewhere the desk clerk will print out directions and very helpfull. We got a very nice breakfast there and wakeup service also. we recommend our friends and family to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Highly Recommeded Hotel to Anyone”
Reviews.Author: Happy40LasVegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed to this hotel for 2 days, all the employee's was very professional and will greet you with smile. The hotel was so clean, quite and affortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone if you are looking for a hotel. It was excellent experience and we would love to come back again to this hotel someday. Thanks, Dennis

Reviews.Title: “Great Employees and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ducewild1962
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Deigo airport and called for the shuttle to pick us up (free, $15 - $20 taxi ride),they were there within 10 minutes to get us. This hotel was clean and the staff was exceptional, very friendly. They drove us free of charge ($15 - $20 taxi ride) to the cruiseship terminal. Upon our return we stayed again and received the same service. I can not say enough about the great staff, they were very friendly and helpful in providing us with local sightseeing information. There is a city bus that stops right outside the hotel and it takes you to the main bus terminal where you can catch a bus or train to anywhere. I would recommend this hotel to any of my freinds and family. I work within the travel industry and have traveled alot myself and find this hotel to be a great value and the great staff is a added bonus. Virginia from New Brunswick, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Convenient,spotless, and a good value”
Reviews.Author: slmatt
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel about five years ago when attending a convention downtown. This is a very affordable gem in a great location. It is not a spa resort or the Ritz, but it is beautifully maintained and has a location that is ten minutes from downtown and close to Sea World, Cabrillo, and other great sites. Each time we have stayed, we have noted the upgrades (marble in the bathrooms, flat screen tv's, and new landscaping). While rooms are average size, they have refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers, and wireless. Breakfast is basic but plentiful and nicely presented. We love being across the street from Point Loma Seafood and being able to walk to restaurants and shops (great Italian, Mexican, Pizza Nova and a wonderful chocolate shop and artisan bread cafe) in Pt. Loma. The marina is right across the street, so it is fun to watch the boats and gaze at the downtown skyline. The staff is very friendly and helpful and quite skilled in making travelers feel at home. We usually come to San Diego two or three times a year and we stayed once on Shelter Island and once at the new Marriott Courtyard at Liberty Station, both very nice, but save your money for shopping, and settle in here. When I ask my wife where she wants to stay, she always says the Ramada in Pt. Loma. It's like home!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: sjtowanda
Reviews.Content: We were in a lovely neighborhood, just steps from the wharf and wonderful restaurants. The staff was quite helpful and even got us discounts on our touristy trips. We were close to everything and the room was nice and we got free newspaper, wi fi and breakfast. Fantastic value and nice people too. What more could anyone ask? Sheila

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Sleazy and Creepy”
Reviews.Author: SeatheMagic
Reviews.Content: It took 3 tries to get a hotel room. The first had someone in it. The second was a "non-smoking room" so full of smoke that our eyes were burning upon stepping into the room. The third was fine, minus the overall grub and the drunk woman puking outside our window. It however was 2 double beds rather than the 2 queen beds we had booked. As we were getting our rooms corrected 2 other couples, came to the front desk with similiar problems. The hotel is older and many of the buildings are only connected via exterior walkways (a common feature of older hotels). We arrived after dark on a Saturday night when the bar was in full swing, with loud music playing, and people milling crowded around the exterior doorways smoking. As women travelling alone we did not feel safe walking these corridors as they were often full of drunken (staggering to the point of almost falling, swearing, etc) men. The bar is on the second floor and very loud. The restroom for the bar is located on a second floor hallway adjacent to some of the hotel rooms, bringing much of the very high bar traffic into the hallway. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back! Outstanding Staff. Hotel is fine.”
Reviews.Author: JayfromMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We found our stay here very pleasant. Staff was simply Outstanding, especailly Jessica. She went well above and beyond - something you just don't see these days..... Rooms were fine, bed was comfortable. Continental breakfast was great. Everyone was nice. Very cute little bar with great people and staff. Very close to several things. Great walking area, and safe. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jacwalker
Reviews.Content: clean, friendly service. nice room with decent sized fridge and microwave. quiet location. we had a little balcony which was great. overall great satisfaction for the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “The most important asset of this hotel is the location”
Reviews.Author: phoenixsuns
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks pretty from the outside, however as you get inside, there is a persistent smell of old, that I really didn't like. The elevator is... scary: small, old, dirty! But there are only two floors, so no big deal , we took the stairs. We had a one king bed room (which is really small, the only thing that helps is the high ceilings) and a two double beds room (which is actually quite spacious and nice). What we liked: you could open the windows, there is a microwave and fridge in each room, the bed and pillows were awesome, really comfy, high speed internet, free parking, great housekeeping, and greatest asset of this hotel: location! What we didn't like: smell, small details such as scratches or stains on the wall and on the door, the bathroom vanity (I can't even describe it, but it was weird - see the photo), rusty hinges, small holes in the bathroom wall, show lack of maintenance. The bathroom is in great need of an upgrade, the towels were clean but old and worn - they need to be replaced. The continental breakfast was good, there were several choices: cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt even waffles on Saturday and Sunday. The breakfast room, though, is quite small, only 4 tables and it gets hard to find an empty table after 9. While it was not perfect, it was ok, we didn't spend too much time in the room anyway during the day. And we booked it through Expedia, so we paid a reasonable price (even though a month ago, for the same money we stayed at Hampton Inn and there is no comparison!). Would I stay there again? Probably not! There are so many choices for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “great location but room had thin walls and needs some work!”
Reviews.Author: Nichobemo
Reviews.Content: The people were very friendly and the breakfast (waffle iron) was very good. I loved walking the area and taking in the boats and people heading out to fish! To bad the rooms had that splashed on paint feel! The place is aging and instead of stripping it and making it better the tried to cover it up. Nice local bar but the noise can be a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Does the things a business traveller wants very well.”
Reviews.Author: PlanetaryTraveller
Reviews.Content: Modern room decor, comfy bed, ironing board, iron, coffee maker, well-lit parking, decent morning complimentary breakfast. Double-glazing on rooms overlooking main road(s) works very much - sound modest. Wi-FI fine. Security cameras and walk arounds give sense of security. Bar appeared to be quiet, even Sat. nite. Suggest avoid rooms near exit doors c/o noise. Washrooms clean but very tiny. Overall, in surprisingly quiet part of town by nice harbour with decent pizza place around corner on water - and not too pricey (viz pizza and beer and tip <$20 all in). Good for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a little noisy.”
Reviews.Author: JayEs2006
Reviews.Content: The room and bed was comfortable. It was a little noisy because our room was right next to the exit to the parking lot and the hallway was elevated on wood. Also the bottom of the stairs leading to the upstairs lounge were located right outside our window. Other than that it was nice and after things quieted down for the night we slept well. f you want to go fishing you can't ask for a better location. The landings are right across the street. The breakfast is one of the better ones I've had and if you don't want the continental breakfast there is a Denny's in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: calhmason
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years and have always enjoyed our stay. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is a good value. The rooms are very clean with refrigerators and microwaves in most rooms. They have done some remodeling over the last couple of years and the furnishings are very nice and comfortable. The hotel has a continental breakfast complete with several cereals, yogurt, bread, juices and a Belgian waffle maker. The breakfast room has several tables. You are only about 10 minutes from either the San Diego Zoo or Sea world. They do have a shuttle to and from the airport. We have recommend this hotel to friends and they have always had nice this to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: sundriedtomatoes
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Rooms were clean and the area was ideal as it was close to both business and the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decient rooms, cheerful staff, we will be back.”
Reviews.Author: seniorboyd
Reviews.Content: It was our anniversary and we wanted to visit the gas lamp district, the Midway, Point Loma National Park (Cabrillo) and our daughter who attends PLNU. We started with a five star hotel in the gas light quarter but just didn't feel comfortable in the room. A little creepy? We left and found room at the Ramada. The staff was cheerful, the room just as big and the price less than half.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: SLOHolder
Reviews.Content: Clean quiet room, helpful staff, central location to our venue

Reviews.Title: “Nice end to a long day of airline delays!”
Reviews.Author: hwahfa
Reviews.Content: We were treated with real curtesy and had the convenience of ironing board, refrigerator, microwave all provided. The service was excellent! Certainly all we could wish for to get a good night sleep before going on our cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Fishermanswife58
Reviews.Content: My husband was going fishing at the pier and I needed to drop him off and bring our car back since he would be gone 10 days. We were told about the Ramada, so we made a reservation. The Ramads is clean (the beds were comfortable and I loved the pillows) the staff is extremely accomodating and helpful, they gave us very good service and a good price. So If you need a place for overnight -definitely try the Ramada. Please remember it is not the Ritz or the Venetian, but was convienent and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaltyDog1234
Reviews.Content: I Travel Quite alot to San Diego, California, for, Pleasure and Business Purposes. I have, stayed, at the Ramada Limited/Airport, on All My stays in San Diego, and, have, been wll Pleased, and, satisfied, with the Hotel, and, the Very Great and Friendly Helpful Staff, They Have at Their Hotel. The Hotel, is, Well Kept, and, Very Budget Minded, for the Area it is located(Pt Loma) I keep Coming Back, and, I cannot, say, How Great this Ramada Limited/Airport. Free Shuttle, to and from the SD Airport to Hotel, is another great feature There. Paul B. of Texas

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother unless you have limited options”
Reviews.Author: soundbit
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on price and location. There are other hotels in the area which we will try next time. It seems to have inadequate standards of what I consider normal maintenance. The property is worn and the painting and maintenace are sub-standard or incomplete. It was not very dirty which would not have been a surprise. We were there for 2 nights on a weekend and saw and heard several members of tour groups on busses (tip - if you stay, get a room far from the lobby). Again, not a bad place if you just want a place to sleep but don't expect to be dazzled or pampered at all. The staff was courteous, and responsive to requests but some have a language barrier (Indian?).

Reviews.Title: “bad deal, dirty”
Reviews.Author: Monkeypalace
Reviews.Content: when we arrived we expected much more from Ramada,by the look of the outside and foyer area. First of all the Indian lady who was at the front desk and was the manager was rude and ubhelpful later in the day when our wireless would not work. We had to drive around to the back where the pool is to park. The room was just grose. It stank and everything,including thye bed was damp. We did complain about this but no one seemed to care. we were charged $110 a night which is ridiculous.We did not even attempt to go down and look at the breakfast. My advice: STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs alot of work”
Reviews.Author: nrcSanJose_CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is needing some good cleaning. The rooms are very basic and they seemed to have updated the vanity and painted the walls in our room at least. The carpets were dirty. Our child was barefoot the 1st night in the room and her feet got filthy. The pool was dirty and not used in awhile. They have a "cocktail lounge" which is basically a pool hall. We passed it a few times to get to our room. The men's bathroom door that the patrons used was open. You could hear all their cursing and conversations as you passed. The rooms were very small and cramped especially the shower/toilet area. Also the shower head was very low. I am 5' 5" and had to duck to get my hair wet. The staff seemed to be friendly but I had a feeling its a family run operation and for a hotel of this size that is not a good thing. They did have complimentary breakfast which we did use. Also alot of traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “well if you I have other choice then won't stay here”
Reviews.Author: disneywonder
Reviews.Content: This place has rooms are OK , we had clean bed sheets and clean bath room. Two double bed. Wifi never worked. Breakfast was nothing comparable to Marriott . Mostly froze stuff, some cereals. free breakfast free parking. For people who like to drink there is a attached bar. This flow of the hotel is such that we never could figure out how to easily reach front desk at all during our 1 night stay. There is one lift and of you have lot s of luggage then there are few places yoy need to lift luggage . b'cos there no matter how you come to your rooms ( some rooms) you will have to cross 3-4 placess where there are 4-5 steps !!! So was really a PAIN. WIFI did not work at all ...even thou signal was fantastic!!! Some thing wrong with the hotel router setup.complaining to front desk did not help.They had no clue!!! ALL in all if you have a better place in mind then stay away from this place. But if you have light luggage and want to catch next flight and want to stay one night then you can stay here.If you have habit of getting drunk then you can do so and walk to your room without driving :-)) So will I stay here next time , no way!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad at all...thought it was a good deal actually”
Reviews.Author: DivemistressofthDark
Reviews.Content: OK, I'm going to depart from the pack here a little...yes, this hotel is dated, and yes, it's got some issues with carpet needing cleaning and the like. However, it also gets extra points for a few amenities you often don't find in hotels with price tags twice this high. I stayed here twice - on both ends of a scuba diving liveaboard trip out to see some great white sharks, long story - and my review applies to both rooms. As I've mentioned in other reviews, certain things usually score extra credit points from me: good ventilation and water pressure, a comfy bed, a quiet room, and access to snacks and soft drinks. This place scored high on all those counts, honestly. Air conditioning worked great, the rooms were comfortable, the bathrooms had recently been remodeled and were quite spacious. One room was just average size, but one was huge! This place actually is something of a flophouse for several companies that run trips out to see the sharks, and some outfits that do sportfishing, so you may want to call ahead to double check room availability. I screwed up my travel plans, then called at 8 AM to book a room for an extra night and it turned out to have been a great thing...I heard later the place filled up shortly thereafter. A couple of real extra credit points to this hotel: There was a fridge and a microwave in each room; the drink and snack machines were amply stocked, not broken, and conveniently located in the lobby - and, oh joy! A change machine! Best of all, this hotel was silent as the grave. I stayed up super late one night and was not awakened early the next morning by loud talking, slamming doors, any of that nonsense. Also, there's plenty of parking, and the hotel is located very near some really wonderful restaurants (we liked the Fish Grotto and, aw heck, another one the name of which escapes me right now...but seriously, there are several outstanding joints within easy walking distance. There's also a Denny's a block away and I had no trouble ordering a pizza late one night.) The neighborhood was just fine, not frightening, and you're within sight of the incredibly beautiful harbor. You're also right on top of the airport, and yet somehow not within the flight path...I didn't hear much jet noise. The Internet worked great!! This one gets REAL points from me...I've stayed in "luxury" hotels where the wireless signal was terrible, or they charged $30 per night or something absurd. At the Ramada, I got a strong, clear signal, no trouble logging on, and no need for a "bridge" for rent from the front desk or similar foolishness. I'd stay here again in a hot second. I think the value is actually pretty good for the price paid. My only real complaint was with the tiny elevator - I had to rearrange my bags a few times to get them onto the cart so it all would fit...

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in your car”
Reviews.Author: hamkola
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a lousy stay. Exceptionally dirty carpets. Took a shower, walked across the room to get dressed, and had black feet. That ruined it for me. Got the "suite", the second room had two queen beds, but one was pushed all the way up against the air conditioner unit intake...at best it drastically decreased the a/c output, at worst it was a fire hazard. Bizarre shower curtain/rod combo, shower curtain would not stay closed. Two tiny trash cans for the whole suite and bathroom, they were overflowing the entire time. Room key cards constantly demagnitized. Continental breakfast was cheap and lousy and the door to the breakfast room remained locked, even during operating hours. Stayed on the 2nd floor, down the hall from the cocktail lounge. Verbally assaulted and propostitioned by disgusting, slobbering drunks nightly. Hallway stunk of cigarette smoke. Lousy parking, usually taken up by the cocktail lounge drunks. Wouldn't ever stay there again, wouldn't ever recommend it to anyone else. Sleep in your car.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Value, Reasonable Location”
Reviews.Author: AlphaMetis
Reviews.Content: This property is just across the (moderately busy) street from San Diego's Shelter Island Sport Fishing Marina. It is a Ramada Limited, after all, not an upscale resort property, so don't have unrealistic expectations. I paid the extra premium for a balcony room, and lucked out with a top floor corner with a balcony that wrapped around and had a very pleasant harbor view. There were even fireworks across the harbor the first night (a Padres game, I think) so that made it all the more worthwhile. Perhaps my experience would have varied in a non-balcony or lower-floor room. I did not try Captain's Quarters, the onsite cocktail lounge and deck, but it seemed to be moderately busy during my stay. I enjoyed many strolls around Shelter Island, and public transit runs every 30 minutes right in front of the property. I had no trouble getting to any of the beaches and other San Diego attractions. The staff/owner appears to live onsite, and all the personnel I had occasion to interact with were polite and helpful. A shuttle to the airport was available with 24 hours notice. The complimentary continental breakfast always had a good variety of items, although when I tried the milk I was fairly certain it was mixed from instant. The local restaurants and fast food are convenient and most are a good value. Loved Santana's for quick and large portioned Baja-Mex, always had something to set aside and reheat later in the in-room microwave! Pizza Nova was fun and poured some really potent cocktails. Point Loma Seafood was interesting but skip the crab cakes! To stock the mini-fridge in your room, there is a Vons market just a few blocks away, plus many other mini-mart-liquor stores nearby. I would like to remind travelers of San Diego's infamous "May Gray" and "June Gloom" weather, most visitor guides conveniently forget to mention the marine layer fog and clouds that frequent those months. Even so, I had many afternoons of sunshine, and don't forget sunblock, even when the sky is gray!

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me??”
Reviews.Author: ron_mexico13
Reviews.Content: I reserved here due to the deceptive photography that shows this place to be far less of a dump than it truly is. Not to mention the fact that the Ramada Limited San Diego Airport is slightly louder than the airport itself. Then the fact that the room felt like a remodeled sanitarium room really did not help. The rat I saw in the "breakfast area" did not improve my opinion and neither did the bumbling ineptitude of the very nervous, unsure woman who claimed to be the manager. This place is a dump and a joke. I would not let my dog stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: acrdon
Reviews.Content: We got scammed by a tourist information centre who charged us $5 to book this godforsaken place for us, which once we got there we couldn't cancel, and we really really wanted to cancel. It was noisy, cramped and horrible. On the plus side, it meant you spent as little a time as possible in your room. It also had wireles internet. The location was good for the airport, which we were flying home from, the breakfasts were fine and the staff friendly. The place needs rebuilding and refurnishing.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very good for my budget. The location was perfect, because it was close to everywhere I wanted to see. They don't have a restaurant in the hotel but there was a lot of choices nearby. The staff was extremely polite. I had free DSL in my room so I was able to check my e-mail. The swimming pool was very nice (of course it's heated) the parking was free. I had a regular room but I got there I noticed they have rooms with bacony facing the marina so I paid a little extra, but it was worth it. Next time I come back to San Diego I know I will coming back to this ramada. By the way they actually remodeled the outside of the hotel and it will be nicer if they had a shuttle to the aiport but is okay

Reviews.Title: “Value with a (Limited) View”
Reviews.Author: KenCT
Reviews.Content: Although sometimes called the Ramada Limited Harbor View, this hotel is officially the Ramada Limited San Diego Airport. Transportation to and from the airport, however is not provided. A cab will cost about $10 including tip. Located on busy Rosecrans Street amid low-end hotels and fishing gear shops, this is an old, but renovated property in the Point Loma area. Staff was universally helpful and accomodating. Room had a color TV with some premium channels, refrigerator and microwave. There was a small table with two chairs in the corner, nowhere near the dataport which was on the phone next to the bed. My king-size bed was extremely comfortable, and the room appeared to have been freshly painted and carpeted; nevertheless the room had a musty institutional feel, not a place where you’d want to spend a lot of time. A simple continental breakfast, daily newspaper, local calls, and use of the Internet in the breakfast area are all complimentary. There's a seedy-looking bar on the second floor and an outdoor pool. Important to note that if you have a car, parking is also free, with room for trucks, buses and campers. For those without transportation, the #28 bus stops directly in front of the hotel every half hour. It’s a ten minute ride to the Old Town Transit Center, from which you can travel just about anywhere in the city. The best part about the hotel’s location, however, is its proximity to two terrific local restaurants. Santana’s, part of a small chain of Mexican restaurants is diagonally across the street, and Point Loma Seafood, considered my many to be the best seafood place in San Diego is about a half block away. Both are extremely casual eat in or take out places.

Reviews.Title: “Awful...Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted to say close to the water. I booked the hotel thru United Escapes and the pictures showed rooms with a harbor view that were clean and nice. Unfortunately, we had a view of the parking lot and the room was so tiny and cramped. The entire hotel had a old musty smell that made you want to leave. However, as I booked the hotel thru United, the room had already been paid for in advance. The heater never worked...just blew cool air. We stayed there in Feb. It was damp and cold at night. I needed internet access. They have it. You have to use their computer..when it is available. To sum it up.. I apoligize to my wife of 25 years for taking her to a dump! We will never stay at any Ramada again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Frequently-travel
Reviews.Content: First, their marketing materials indicate that they provide a free shuttle from airport. WRONG - it does not exist! So, we had to get a taxi for $8 (plus tip) to the Ramada Limited. Talk about Limited. The rooms were tiny and cramped - worst I have stayed in in years. The Continental breakfast was also extremely limited. Plus, get this, they don't give out loyalty points for "discounted rates" even though the rate I paid was more than what they have posted on their website. There is no view of the city from the hotel, so don't believe the pictures of the harbor view. The taxi back to the airport cost another $5 (plus tip.) The staff at the front desk simply couldn't care less! Although I like Ramada properties, I strongly recommend against staying at this particular location.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada San Diego Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 1403 Rosecrans Street, San Diego, CA 92106
